intro: Cordiera mussunungae, commonly known as the Philippine cordiera, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in lowland to montane forests, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
